Reviews.Title: “Great choice and a great price!”
Reviews.Author: camak
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights on business. I used to stay here before it's ownership change. Hotel is very adequate; location is good, amenities are sound and the staff are wonderful. If you're looking for a flash serviced apartment then this is not the place for you - it's rather old but it still has a lot if charm. It's clean and the bed is comfy. The balconies are very small though - and not so good if you're afraid if heights or you're a smoker since it's a 100% non smoking hotel. The kitchen is fully functional and the shower is great. I recommend this place :-)

Reviews.Title: “Shabby hotel needs serious renovation”
Reviews.Author: JohnZ05
Reviews.Content: Nothing much to say about this hotel except that it is a dump and certainly not a 4 star but more a 1 or zero star. Was in a "Premier" One bedroom but still wonder what was premier (maybe the price and the dirtyness?) I seriously think that it has not been renovated for more than 20 years and as a consequence, everything is dirty and outdated in both the common areas and the room. Room is spacious but everything is stained and old from the carpets to the TVs (maybe the crappiest and oldest TVs I have seen within my last 10 years of travelling). Bedsheets were dirty ("OMG" said the desk clerk when I showed them to him), bathroom full of mold, location not even good and staff not particularly friend. And overall, massively overpriced. Avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Seasons Harbour - not like the others”
Reviews.Author: MarcosKinz
Reviews.Content: I was in this 4th Seasons Hotel. despite the the good location,the hotel needs renovation. Price are too high for what it is offering. Staff very good, but the Gym is old, sauna dirty and I did not try the pool. Also, very noise in the morning and late night as the windows are not acoustic sealed. Of course, Harbour brings a benefit, but, only this.

Reviews.Title: “Disorganised, understaffed and a phantom housekeeping department!”
Reviews.Author: annabellequinn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a group booking for a wedding party. It had been made clear to the hotel that after the wedding ceremony (an hour's drive from the hotel) most of the guests would be arriving and checking in before the wedding reception. Had the hotel made provision for this? Unfortunately not and pandemonium ensued. We were fortunate as we arrived a lot later than the first wave of check-ins who were STILL waiting in reception or had returned to reception trying to sort out the non-working electronic room keys. It was major kerfuffle! Finally checked into room - asked for champagne glasses. We are, to this day, still waiting. The bedroom and bathroom were nice - self contained kitchen was nice, but far from well-appointed. Lounge and furnishings were grubby and covered in blackish grimy wear and tear marks. UGH The hotel management had displayed a "we are upgrading" notice but that didn't help us! The only upside was that we had free parking courtesy of the group booking negotiations, so that was a bonus. The hotel was convenient to Darling Harbour, but that's about all it had going for it. OK for an overnight stay but certainly wouldn't want to spend an extended holiday here.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience”
Reviews.Author: Jambakim
Reviews.Content: Taking the details on the hotel website at face value was my first mistake . . . misrepresentation is probably a good word and made a five day stay not the experience it could have been. The staff are friendly, helpful as they can be under the circumstances and don't deserve to have to deal with the issues that arise as a result of this hotel being below standard . . . certainly not the four stars it claims. there is clearly no quality control practised here. Where to start with the problems: For a refurbished room the walls were in need of a good lick of paint; the blind in the bedroom was broken and couldn't be opened; drawers in wardrobe were broken and collapsed when attempting to open any of them; the safe was locked and needed staff to open it; no dishwasher (website states each room has one) and not even a dish cloth to compensate for the absence of the dishwasher; remote for one television was broken and taped together; no drinking glasses in the room; washing machine didn't work and dryer worked intermittently; button on toilet broken and no plug for the bathroom sink; no sharp knife in kitchen; one teaspoon and very little other cutlery; very little in the way of cooking pots and pans; two of the three lights in living room had blown globes; kitchen floor was sticky. Some of the issues such as light globes, dishwashing equipment, kitchen utensils, sink plug etc could be easily fixed. to assist with clothes washing we were offered the use of a washing machine in another apartment, but guess what it didn't work properly either (washed but would not rinse or spin). staff eventually took our washing and made other arrangements to have it washed and dried (they shouldn't have to do this). This is by far the worst establishment that I have stayed in and certainly not the worth the price that I paid. this will be one group of hotels that I will steer clear of in future which is a shame because it is in a great location and parking was available at a reasonable price given the length of time we were staying.

Reviews.Title: “JUST WHAT WE WANTED - NEEDED!!”
Reviews.Author: MrsJenNZ
Reviews.Content: We booked through a 'third-party' hoping that we would get the requested a one bedroom 'share-twin' apartment. We rang the Hotel 48 hours previously to also ensure this arrangment. We were told, "It would be noted!" NO WORRIES!! All went according to our wants. The apartment was ideal for us in size, the site close to Darling Harbour, all equipment included. We had a very small balcony, but when outside it gave an insight into the city traffic ... even from 9 floors up. It was quiet with windows shut, the air cond worked, though drafty depending on where you sat. All staff were approachable and extremely pleasant. We had occasion to ask many questions within first 12 hours, but all our questions and requests were taken seriously and respectfully. We had issues with the washing machine in the apartment, but this was replaced with a new one within 24 hours! The spa was not working which was a shame, but the pool was available. It was a little 'cool' and didn't get any warmer over the 7 days we were there, but we were told it is checked often and is the required temperature. In the pool area, there were lots of extra towels available / 2 extra showers / wheelchair changing room & shower impressive. Would recommend this hotel and would stay there again if I ever re.visited Sydney!!

Reviews.Title: “What a dump”
Reviews.Author: ducrmp
Reviews.Content: We booked a "deluxe" room in July 2011 after seeing their website and a photo of a modern apartment as part of a 2 month holiday to Australia. When we went into the room it was as if we had walked into a mid 1980's time warp ! it was old fashioned, dark and dirty with frayed carpets, badly stained chairs and sofa, a tiny bathroom with all the fittings stained, scratched or broken. We compained but were reassured that this was indeed the room we had booked. Eventually after 24 hours, we were "upgraded" to a premium room, which was exactly the same only bigger with the added extras of no net curtains and badly fitted curtains despite looking directly into an office block and single glazed windows that had a tendency to come off the runners. The crockery was mismatched, chipped and badly worn in both rooms, the utensils and cooker were old and there was no way I would have used them for food preparation. We were repeatedly told that the building was to have a full refurbishment but when we pointed out that we had booked because of their advertising literature and it was a gross misrepresentation, all we got was a shrug of shoulders. Please don't be as disappointed as us after paying a small fortune. DON'T book this hotel apartment block.

Reviews.Title: “Would highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: WallyowlOrpinton
Reviews.Content: Having read reviews prior to our visit we were concerned about this hotel. We need not have worried !The apartment contained all the amenities you could wish for and all were in good working order. It is in a great location, about 200 yards from Cockle Bay , part of Darling horbour. We found the staff extremely helpful in advising us and making recommendations for restaurants. The hotel is undergoing renovations, having only recently been taken over by the "Seaons" group. I expect that after this refurb. it will be even better. We will definitely stay here on our next visit to Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Formerly Somerset Hotel - perfect for what we needed”
Reviews.Author: majmcd
Reviews.Content: We traveled Dec 31, 2010 until mid January 2011. We were in the middle of a 3 week trip (came over from the eastern US), so we wanted a place with a kitchen and laundry so we could live more like we did at home. The ammenities were great. We did pay a premium for the first few days since we celebrated new years eve in Sydney. The first day, the laundry did not work, so we had to haul it up multiple floors to another room, which was annoying, but the staff had the laundry fixed within 2 days. The concerige was terrible. She had very little knowledge of non-touristy things in Sydney, which was disappointing. Also, for the price of the room, it felt outrageous that internet was not included. The hotel was perfect for what we needed. It was serviced daily. The room was large and had a separate living room kitchen area that could be closed off from the bedroom. The location was perfect for sightseeing around Sydney as well. I would highly recommend it for people coming for a longer stay and needing an apartment type place. It has changed management since, so I cannot speak to that.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Rooms. Great Location. Noisy. OK Staff”
Reviews.Author: Love_Travelling_OZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 1 bedroom apartment on level 3 for 3 weeks when we moved from Adelaide to Sydney. After a lot of research I chose this hotel because the rooms had all the amenities we wanted - a means to cook food and also to wash our clothes. We could also shut the door to the bedroom (it was a sliding door to divide the room in 2 from the living area). The price was also very good. As we were on level 3 the room was very noisy and we could continually hear the traffic even with the windows shut. The airconditioning was broken so it made the room very stuffy at night. The door lock was continually broken so we were continually at reception getting them to let us into our room. Our problems with this hotel stem from it being old and needing an update/repairs. It has recently become part of the seasons group so maybe they will look at bringing it up to spec in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: AussieStrategist
Reviews.Content: Ordinary property in need of renovation. Pleasant staff but that's about it. Only stay if you need the location or cheap accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Loacation”
Reviews.Author: BernieM1950
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a long weekend in Sydney and stayed at Seasons Harbour Plaza, 252 Sussex Street, Sydney. These apartments have recently come under the management of Seasons Apartment Hotel Group, and the building is undergoing a staged redevelopment, which is timely. Even the units that have not been refurbished, are spacious and comfortable. The location of the Apartments is very central to Sydney CBD, being about 50 metres from the Sydney Town Hall and the Queen Victoria Building. If you go 200 metres in the opposite direction, you find yourself at Darling Harbour, with all its attractions. The big thing that Seasons Harbour Plaza has going for it is its staff. They are very friendly and efficient. Nothing is too much trouble. We will certainly be going back and look forward to seeing the changes as a result of the refurbishment. The one thing that is lacking is access to an Ice Machine, but you never know, that may be in the pipeline. When we asked for ice, they got some from an adjoining restaurant for us. Well done Season's staff, you made our stay very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely staff, and very good facilities”
Reviews.Author: CherylandGus
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a cosy, comfortable apartment a couple of minutes walk from Darling Harbour, then this is the place. We were pleasantly surprised to find this lovely hotel with a great location. From the time we checked in with the very friendly and helpful front office staff until we checked out it was a great experience. Our appartment room was lovely, very clean,and spacious. The only negative being the bathroom was on the small side, but the bonus was a washing machine and cloths dryer which was great for us as we were travelling through and got to do quite a bit of washing and got everything dryed. We will definately be staying at the hotel again and can confidently recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but needs a make over.”
Reviews.Author: SKIIERTORBAY
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the beginning of November just as it was being taken over from the Somerset group.We were a group of four, we had read the the reviews before we booked so a mail exchange assured us we would be well looked after and we were, we had an upgrade to the penthouse suite all very spacious but I,m afraid a little tired. The staff were great , vert helpful even suggesting that we went round the corner to enjoy free flat whites and wifi. The location is great, just round the corner from darling harbour. We enjoyed our stay here, but 4 star it ain't, the Seasons group will need to do a major upgrade to warrant 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “So Slow”
Reviews.Author: Shirley g
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in December 2011. I asked when I booked for an early check in as we would be arriving by train. After waiting well over half an to check in, we were told that they did not have a room ready. As I was attending a business lunch, I had no option but to changed my clothes in the toilet. After attending the luncheon, we arrived back at the hotel at 3.00pm only to be told that they still did not have a room ready for us. We were left sitting in the Foyer. Due to bad weather, my Husband and I were very wet and again looking forward to changing into dry clothes. Again we waited half an hour until my Husband approached the desk and complained about the poor service. Finally after 7 hours of trying to get a room that was booked days in advance were we given a room. Never again the service was a disgrace.

Reviews.Title: “Beware change of name to Seasons”
Reviews.Author: kathleen g
Reviews.Content: The change of name caused confusion at the beginning of our holiday as we were driving by looking for the Somerset Apartments and had to park the car and eventually found the apartments. The apartments have a great location for Darling harbour and the walkway is just across the road. It was also good to have a roomy 1 bedroom apartment which had clothes washing and drying facilities on hand in the apartment. The only couple of issues we had was that the dishwasher did not work, if you switched it on it fused all the other electrics in the apartment, we reported this to reception and they advised it would be fixed, we came back later to the apartment to see that the dishwasher had been moved however all that had been done was to switch it on and as a result all the other electrics were off - which meant that we had a flood in the kitchen from the defrosted refrigerator that had our food and drinks in it, the housekeeping staff also tookaway my 2 personal dish drying cloths that I had brought on holiday with us,and had to use them as the dishwasher was not working which we did not get returned and I had to purchase more for the rest of our trip in Australia. Housekeeping only provided 1 handtowel for 2 people, when I asked for another I was given a face cloth.

HotelInfo.Name: Seasons Harbour Plaza
HotelInfo.Address: No. 252 Sussex Street, Darling Harbour, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia (Formerly Somerset Darling Harbour)
